HelpXML.Title: OPTpsider
HelpXML.Purpose: OPTpsider computes derivative of psi function (second derivative of rho function) for optimal weight function

Item.Name: u
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector containing residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample

Item.Name: c
Item.LongDesc: Scalar greater than 0 which controls the robustness/efficiency of the estimator (beta in regression or mu in the location case ...)

Item.Name: psider
Item.TypeInd: Values of the derivative of the optimal psi function associated to the residuals or Mahalanobis distances for the n units of the sample.

HelpXML.MoreAbout: Function OPTpsider transforms vector x as follows \[ OPTpsider(u,c) = \left\{ \begin{array}{cc} (1/3.25*c^2) & |u| \leq 2c \\ (1/3.25) \left( -1.944 \frac{1}{c^2} + 1.728 \frac{3u^2}{c^4} - 0.312 \frac{5u^4}{c^6} + 0.016 \frac{7u^6}{c^8} \right) & \qquad 2c \leq |u| \leq 3c \\ 0 & |u|>3c \\ \end{array} \right. \] Remark: Optimal psi-function is almost linear around u = 0 in accordance with Winsor's principle that all distributions are normal in the middle. This means that \psi (u)/u is approximately constant over the linear region of \psi, so the points in that region tend to get equal weight.

References.Item: Maronna, R.A., Martin D. and Yohai V.J. (2006), Robust Statistics, Theory and Methods, Wiley, New York.
